Question
========

The null hypothesis is tested which states that the proportion is 0.3 against the alternative which states that the proportion is greater than 0.3. The significance level used is 0.025. The sample size is 20 and it is assumed that according to the central limit theorem the *sampling distribution* is approximately normally distributed. From what proportion can the null hypothesis be rejected?

Answerlist
----------

* 0.35
* 0.4452
* 0.5008

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.35: Incorrect
* 0.4452: Incorrect
* 0.5008: Correct
